com.milk.uberchat.spacebar
Class SBSystem

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.milk.uberchat.base.BaseEntity
        |
        +--com.milk.uberchat.base.BaseSystem
              |
              +--com.milk.uberchat.spacebar.SBSystem
All Implemented Interfaces:
ChatEntity, ChatSystem, Commandable, Editable
public class SBSystem
extends BaseSystem

This is the SpaceBar-specific ChatSystem.

Author:
Dan Bornstein, danfuzz@milk.com
, Copyright 1998 Dan Bornstein, all rights reserved.

private SBChannel myCurrentChannel
the current channel--SpaceBar only allows one active channel

myNominallyLeftChannel

private boolean myNominallyLeftChannel
whether we have "nominally" left the current channel. That is, whether it's okay to actually switch channels (and not complain about not being able to be on more than one channel at once)

myConnectionHandler

private SBConnectionHandler myConnectionHandler
the connection handler that does a lot of our dirty work

Method Detail

canonicalUserName

public java.lang.String canonicalUserName(java.lang.String orig)
Turn the given user name into its canonical form. For the SpaceBar, it's just lower-cased and interned.

Specified by:
canonicalUserName in interface ChatSystem
Specified by:
canonicalUserName in class BaseSystem
Parameters:
orig - the original name
Returns:
the canonical form

canonicalChannelName

public java.lang.String canonicalChannelName(java.lang.String orig)
Turn the given channel name into its canonical form. For the SpaceBar, we try to treat everything as a number, padding with a 0 if it's only one digit. If it's not a number from 1 to 99, then we return null.

Specified by:
canonicalChannelName in interface ChatSystem
Specified by:
canonicalChannelName in class BaseSystem
Parameters:
orig - the original name
Returns:
the canonical form

protected void systemDisconnect()
Disconnect from this system.

Specified by:
systemDisconnect in class BaseSystem

callSystemDisconnected

private void callSystemDisconnected()
Simply call systemDisconnected in our superclass. This method exists to work around a bug in javac where it refused to compile this call inside the inner class in systemDisconnect, above.

bugReport

Send a bugReport event to whoever is listening to this system.

Parameters:

callBroadcast

void callBroadcast(BaseEvent ev)
Call BaseEntity.broadcast() on an event. This is defined to give this package access to an otherwise-protected method.

Parameters:
ev - the event to broadcast

dispatchBroadcast

void dispatchBroadcast(BaseEvent ev)
Cast the source of the given event and call the appropriate callBroadcast() method. This is how one can generically create and send out events without allowing the outside world to have the same power.

Parameters:
ev - the event to broadcast

doConnect

private void doConnect()
This method gets called in a thread when a systemConnect request gets made.
